org.spongepowered.api.entity

Interface Entity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataHolder, EntityState, Identifiable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Aerial, Ageable, Agent, Ambient, Animal, Aquatic, ArmorStand, Arrow, Bat, Blaze, Boat, Boss, CaveSpider, Chicken, ComplexLiving, ComplexLivingPart, Cow, Creeper, DamagingProjectile, Egg, EnderCrystal, EnderDragon, EnderDragonPart, Enderman, Endermite, EnderPearl, ExperienceOrb, Explosive, EyeOfEnder, FallingBlock, Fireball, Firework, FishHook, FusedExplosive, Ghast, Giant, Golem, Guardian, Hanging, Horse, Human, IgnitableExplosive, IronGolem, Item, ItemFrame, LargeFireball, LeashHitch, Lightning, Living, MagmaCube, Minecart, MinecartChest, MinecartCommandBlock, MinecartContainer, MinecartFurnace, MinecartHopper, MinecartMobSpawner, MinecartRideable, MinecartTNT, Monster, Mooshroom, Ocelot, Painting, Pig, Player, PrimedTNT, Projectile, Rabbit, Sheep, Silverfish, Sittable, Skeleton, Slime, SmallFireball, Snowball, SnowGolem, Spider, Squid, Tameable, ThrownExpBottle, ThrownPotion, Villager, WeatherEffect, Witch, Wither, WitherSkull, Wolf, Zombie, ZombiePigman

    public interface Entity
extends Identifiable, EntityState, DataHolder
    An entity is a Minecraft entity.

    Examples of entities include:

    • Zombies
    • Sheep
    • Players
    • Dropped items
    • Dropped experience points
    • etc.

    Blocks and items (when they are in inventories) are not entities.

      • setLocation

        boolean setLocation(Location location)
        Sets the location of this entity. This is equivalent to a teleport, and also moves this entity's passengers.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        Returns:
        True if the teleport was successful

      • setLocationAndRotation

        boolean setLocationAndRotation(Location location,
                               com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3f rotation,
                               java.util.EnumSet<RelativePositions> relativePositions)
        Moves the entity to the specified location, and sets the rotation. RelativePositions listed inside the EnumSet are considered relative.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        rotation - The rotation to set
        relativePositions - The coordinates to set relatively
        Returns:
        True if the teleport was successful

        Returns:
        The vehicle entity, if it exists

      • getBaseVehicle

        Entity getBaseVehicle()
        Gets the entity vehicle that is the base of what ever stack the current entity is a part of. This can be the current entity, if it is not riding any vehicle.

        The returned entity can never ride another entity, that would make the ridden entity the base of the stack.

        Returns:
        The vehicle entity

      • setPassenger

        boolean setPassenger(@Nullable
                     Entity entity)
        Sets the passenger entity(the entity that rides this one).
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity passenger, or null to eject
        Returns:
        True if the set was successful

      • setVehicle

        boolean setVehicle(@Nullable
                   Entity entity)
        Sets the vehicle entity(the entity that is ridden by this one).
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity vehicle, or null to dismount
        Returns:
        True if the set was successful
